segment.source: High-Level Architecture
segment.target: High-Level Architecture

segment.source: High-Level Architecture
segment.target: High-Level Architecture

segment.source: High-Level Architecture
segment.target: High-Level Architecture

segment.source: This section describes the high-level system architecture and component design of Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.
segment.target: This section describes the high-level system architecture and component design of Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.

segment.source: System Architecture
segment.target: System Architecture

segment.source: MED-V enhances Windows Virtual PC to run two operating systems on one device, adding virtual image delivery, Group Policy-based provisioning, and centralized management.
segment.target: MED-V enhances Windows Virtual PC to run two operating systems on one device, adding virtual image delivery, Group Policy-based provisioning, and centralized management.

segment.source: By using MED-V, you can easily configure, deploy, and manage corporate Windows Virtual PC images on any Windows-based desktop running Windows 7 Professional, Enterprise, or Windows 7 Ultimate.
segment.target: By using MED-V, you can easily configure, deploy, and manage corporate Windows Virtual PC images on any Windows-based desktop running Windows 7 Professional, Enterprise, or Windows 7 Ultimate.

segment.source: The MED-V solution includes the following components:
segment.target: The MED-V solution includes the following components:

segment.source: MED-V Host
segment.target: MED-V Host

segment.source: A Windows 7 environment that includes a MED-V Host Agent, an electronic software distribution (ESD) system, a registry management system, and a MED-V guest.
segment.target: A Windows 7 environment that includes a MED-V Host Agent, an electronic software distribution (ESD) system, a registry management system, and a MED-V guest.

segment.source: The MED-V host interacts with the MED-V guest so that certain setup functions and system information can be processed.
segment.target: The MED-V host interacts with the MED-V guest so that certain setup functions and system information can be processed.

segment.source: MED-V Host Agent
segment.target: MED-V Host Agent

segment.source: The MED-V software contained in the MED-V host that provides a channel to communicate with the MED-V guest.
segment.target: The MED-V software contained in the MED-V host that provides a channel to communicate with the MED-V guest.

segment.source: It also provides functionality such as first time setup and application publishing.
segment.target: It also provides functionality such as first time setup and application publishing.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: After MED-V and its required components are installed MED-V must be configured.
segment.target: After MED-V and its required components are installed MED-V must be configured.

segment.source: The configuration of MED-V is referred to as first time setup.
segment.target: The configuration of MED-V is referred to as first time setup.

segment.source: ESD System
segment.target: ESD System

segment.source: Your existing software distribution method that lets you deploy and install the MED-V workspace package files that MED-V creates.
segment.target: Your existing software distribution method that lets you deploy and install the MED-V workspace package files that MED-V creates.

segment.source: Registry Management System
segment.target: Registry Management System

segment.source: Your existing method of managing Group Policy settings and preferences.
segment.target: Your existing method of managing Group Policy settings and preferences.

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC Image
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC Image

segment.source: An administrator-defined virtual machine that contains the following components:
segment.target: An administrator-defined virtual machine that contains the following components:

segment.source: Corporate Operating System
segment.target: Corporate Operating System

segment.source: Your standard corporate operating system.
segment.target: Your standard corporate operating system.

segment.source: Management and Security Tools
segment.target: Management and Security Tools

segment.source: Your standard management and security tools, such as virus protection.
segment.target: Your standard management and security tools, such as virus protection.

segment.source: MED-V Guest
segment.target: MED-V Guest

segment.source: A Windows XP SP3 environment, as part of a Windows Virtual PC running on Windows 7 that contains the following components:
segment.target: A Windows XP SP3 environment, as part of a Windows Virtual PC running on Windows 7 that contains the following components:

segment.source: MED-V Guest Agent
segment.target: MED-V Guest Agent

segment.source: The MED-V software contained in the MED-V guest that provides a channel to communicate with the MED-V host.
segment.target: The MED-V software contained in the MED-V guest that provides a channel to communicate with the MED-V host.

segment.source: It also supports the MED-V Host Agent with functions like performing first time setup.
segment.target: It also supports the MED-V Host Agent with functions like performing first time setup.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The MED-V Guest Agent is installed automatically during first time setup.
segment.target: The MED-V Guest Agent is installed automatically during first time setup.

segment.source: ESD Client
segment.target: ESD Client

segment.source: An optional part of your ESD system that installs software packages and reports status to the ESD system.
segment.target: An optional part of your ESD system that installs software packages and reports status to the ESD system.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Planning for Application Operating System Compatibility
